website_summaries.verdict: A veterinarian-recommended probiotic by a top company that is suitable for cats and kittens that frequently experience stomach issues and diarrhea.
pros: Formulated to ease feline diarrhea and other digestive concerns
Patent-pending formula is made by Purina, a  recognizable brand in pet care products
cons: Some customers received product that was close to the expiration date
May not produce results for all cats

website_summaries.verdict: This may not be the best for sensitive pets, but we recommend this supplement as an appetite stimulant.
pros: Effective and fast when combined with antibiotics
cons: Not ideal for cats on "limited ingredient" diets

customer_reviews.title: Contains dead animals.
customer_reviews.text: The most concerning ingredient in this product was that the main ingredient is “Animal digest”. Google what that is. Basically, it’s parts of dead animals. These can be euthanized pets or other animals with little regulation on how/where they are obtained from. Purina does address that this is “safe”, but seriously, why would you want to feed your pet bits of euthanized animals? We discussed with out vet, who theorized Purina puts in one bacteria to count as a “probiotic”, but really this product is a way for them to profit off of waste products from their pet food. Save your money, go to a vet, and get a cheaper and better product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: My 23 year old & 21 year old cats LOVE this product and definitely feel friskier!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Mariarossi

customer_reviews.title: Main ingredient contains diseased or euthanized animals
customer_reviews.text: I stopped buying this when I found out the first ingredient of animal digest is legally allowed to contain diseased and or euthanized animals. more info on the truth about pet food site in the article titled Popular Vet Recommended Supplement Contains Questionable Ingredient. An FDA investigation found many commonly sold pet foods in the US contained a drug used to euthanize animals; pentobarbital. This FDA report (second page, Appendix) stated “There appear to be associations between rendered or hydrolyzed ingredients and the presence of pentobarbital in dog food. The ingredients Meat and Bone Meal, Beef and Bone Meal, Animal Fat, and Animal Digest are rendered or hydrolyzed from animal sources that could include euthanized animals.”
customer_reviews.author: lov4lif

customer_reviews.title: This is essentially a probiotic for your cat. There ...
customer_reviews.text: This is essentially a probiotic for your cat. There should be live bacteria in each packet for your cat to consume in order to aid digesiont. Over time, the bacteria die. That is why there is an expiration date on the package. The product delivered to me had an expiration date prior to the order date.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Find different source - Product expires in 1 MONTH from receipt!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product that has really helped my cats digestive issues. However, find another more reliable source to purchase from. The 3 boxes I received all expired in a month from date I received them. I've purchased this directly from my Vet at a higher cost and with the inconvenience of driving to his office to pick it up and the expiration date was always a year out. Can't imaging this product will have the desired outcome for your cats if it is expired or old.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Fake product
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. it is a fake. It is yellow in color not tan. Smells different and the description says country of origin is China. Purina is a US company and the real FortiFlora is packaged differently. I was concerened when I opened the box and the packets were stacked on one another and not side by side as the ones from my vet.
customer_reviews.author: Billie

customer_reviews.title: "Animal Digest" ingredient can cause allergic reaction in cats with food allergies (chicken/pork).
customer_reviews.text: My cat had diarrhea from antibiotics and this cleared it up in only 2 days. However, my cat has food allergies and so she has scabs all around her neck from just one serving. Apparently the "animal digest" in the ingredients must have chicken/pork in it which triggered her to be itchy from the allergy. I wish there was more warning on the box about possible allergic reactions in food sensitive animals.
customer_reviews.author: JWTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Our cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our Vet recommended this for our rescue kitty, a toothless senior guy with FIV and other medical issues. They sell it in their office, but it's more economical to purchase it here. The Vet said the important thing is that the powder isn't clumped or moist, that it is dry. I've purchased the 30 packet FortiFlora Probiotic several times through this seller and it's always very fresh. I just add one packet per day into his breakfast (wet food) and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Just my two cents ...

customer_reviews.title: My cat didn't like it at all and I don't know about the ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat didn't like it at all and I don't know about the probiotics, are they alive? I read that you can give your cat like 1/6 a human probiotic so I do that sometimes and it has no weird ingredients. I wanted it to work because my cat is old and doesn't like to eat sometimes but she didn't like this. I'm glad it helps other cats.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My Cancer Kitty Loves her "Sean Spices"
customer_reviews.text: I really do very rarely write reviews for products. But I've got a 16-year-old cat who has cancer and is undergoing chemo, and sometimes she needs a little more incentive to eat her canned food. We just add what we joke are her "sean spices" to her dish, and she comes running out of the bushes when she hears the packets rustling. I don't know if the packets actually do anything for her nutritional health as a probiotic, but they ALWAYS get her to scarf down her food, and I'm so, so grateful for it!!
customer_reviews.author: Taylor C.

customer_reviews.title: Best use date was 15 days after I received
customer_reviews.text: I received this on 2/26/19. The Best Use by date was 3/13/19. These 30 packets should last my cat several months and I expected a use by date of at least 6 months to a year from purchase. I am returning and will have to buy at a much higher price from my vet as I am almost out.
customer_reviews.author: Panthera

customer_reviews.title: This definitely helps
customer_reviews.text: My poor kitten has had stomach problems since I brought her home from the humane society. I've had her to the vets twice and they have no idea what is causing her issues, she has bloody diarrhea and a bloated stomach. But this helped firm up her poop. And it's cheaper than buying it from the vet directly.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Did nothing for antibiotic related diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: My two cats were put on antibiotics, one for an upper respiratory infection and the other as a preventative so they wouldn't catch it. Both got antibiotic related diarrhea and were both given one pack a day with a serving of soft food. While they both loved the flavor and licked their bowls clean, FortiFlora did nothing to reduce the severity of or prevent their diarrhea.
customer_reviews.author: bluttmer

customer_reviews.title: MADE IN CHINA
customer_reviews.text: Yes, my cat loves the flavor. But I love the flavor of chocolate and soda pop. MADE IN CHINA My cat''s poo really really smells offensive. In my opinion, this should not be the case if the food or probiotic is agreeing with the kitty. I volunteer for the Humane Society socializing and petting the kitties. They sprinkle Advita on the dry food of many of the cats. The poop is not offensive. The cats don't seem to object to it and it apparently helps them with digestion.
customer_reviews.author: Pocket Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Helped solidifying stool!
customer_reviews.text: We found and had to bottle feed a newborn kitten that was pulled away from its mom in a semi trailer. He was having such a hard time when we transitioned him from the bottle to kitten food and his poops were absolutely watery. We put just a little bit of this in his food and not only did he love it but the stool solidified same day. Used less than half of a packet to start seeing results.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: There are times when kitty just needs or wants this...
customer_reviews.text: For anyone who has cats for a long time, you will know that sometimes cats just walk away from food. I am referring to wet food, as we don't use kibble. Out of all of my cats, I have one who is just picky and sometimes walks away from his plate. When he does this, I sprinkle on a bit of the FortiFlora, and Viola! He eats. I don't buy it for the probiotics as I think you can find better ones for cats. But this is just the right thing when you have a kitty that turns their nose up at food from time to time. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Sniggih

customer_reviews.title: Product Excellent, Shipment Dissatisfactory
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be very helpful for the cat's tummy and litter box activity. He also likes it. We sprinkle it on his wet food like seasoning. I couldn't find a place to provide feedback about the shipment, so I'm putting that here. The product box arrived in a poly bubble bag. The box was smashed flat and the foil envelopes inside distorted.
customer_reviews.author: Otter Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love it
customer_reviews.text: Our vet recommended this for our male cat's occasional diarrhea, and she said its the only brand she would recommend. I've been giving it to all 3 of our cats for general health benefits, and they all love it! And no diarrhea so far! To the reviewers who are horrified about possible "dead animals" ingredients, what do you think ground beef and steaks and chicken breasts are?? Dead animals. (One of the reasons why I'm vegetarian.) All pet food is made from dead animals as well, if you want to look at it that way.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Cat Hates the Taste
customer_reviews.text: I missed the deadline to return this by one day. (My fault - overtaken by other events.) This may be an excellent product. It was recommended by my vet. I opened one packet and put only small amounts into cat's food over a few meals to get his system used to it. Nothing doin'. He hated the taste (smell? -with a cat who knows?) He is not a fussy eater, but he was having none of it. Worth a try if your cat needs it, but watch the return limit date in case yours won't eat it either.
customer_reviews.author: K. Walker

customer_reviews.title: This is the stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I learned about this when I was doing hospice for a cat rescue group. A vet recommended it for the cat I was taking care of, and I believe it extended his life. Recently, I did a course of it for my senior gentleman, who had been having significant gastric distress. He improved so quickly and so dramatically that I bought a box for my friend, whose elder girls had been ill. This stuff works. If you read the box, it's not just the stuff you get in people yogurt. It firms up what needs firming up and also seems to stop nausea. I wish I had known about this 20 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Fortiflora helps picky eaters
customer_reviews.text: Since using Fortiflora we have seen less diarrhea & eating problems in all our cats. This includes inside & outside ferals. They are becoming a bit healthier on the probiotics. It is a little expensive but seems to be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicki S. Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Not helping yellow diarrhea
customer_reviews.text: Kitty liked it at first. Flavor got old for him in a few days. Gave him this for constant yellow diarrhea and it started working to thicken to less watery yellow diarrhea. Kitty didn't look much better long run and I felt I was just postponing whatever treatments he needed. Also this brand of cat food with similar claims didn't help him at all. I'm probably letting my other cat eat the food. She's fine with it.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Evans

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE! My cat got VERY sick!
customer_reviews.text: We have been using Fortiflora for our cat for years...Have never had a problem. I usually purchase from Chewy online. Since I have Prime and needed it right away, I purchased it from here. BAD IDEA! The product seemed the same, but made my cat very, very sick. He had diarrhea for almost a week before I made the connection. Stopped the Fortiflora and it went away within 12 hours. Thankfully, he is fine now. Bad batch or counterfeit product? Not sure, but I will not be getting it from here ever again. Be mindful and careful with your fur baby! I will only purchase from Chewy or my vet's office from now on.
customer_reviews.author: KLC

customer_reviews.title: Helped cat’s feeding issues
customer_reviews.text: The vet recommended this probiotic for my cat who was having feeding issues. He is an older cat and he was vomiting/refusing food. I noticed a change in his eating habits within a day or so of adding this to his food. He is eating normally again (it’s been maybe 2 weeks since we started him on this) and I can tell he’s putting on weight again. So fingers crossed that it continues to help!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan Engel

customer_reviews.title: Allergy warning
customer_reviews.text: This product includes chicken, so if your cat is allergic to chicken I recommend skipping this. I contacted the company, since there is nothing in the ingredients about chicken and they confirmed that "animal digest" includes chicken livers. They said it is hydrolized, so it is hypoallergenic. I have three cats with chicken allergies and they are all itching and pulling their hair out after eating this product. It was an expensive disaster. If your cat is allergic to chicken, use at your own risk.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Redd

customer_reviews.title: INDIVIDUAL PACKAGES WERE UNDER PORTIONED AND ALMOST EMPTY!
customer_reviews.text: I bough this product few times because it was recommended by my veterinarian. My cats seem to like it but every time the portions inside the individual packages were different. My last order specially was significantly less than the regular portions. I usually divide one package in a two meals but this patch was ridiculously low almost feel as each package was less than the other. It’s not cheap product for the price and they shouldn’t cheat their regular customers like this!! I would not recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Zen Z

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive but the cat doesn't care - he loves it and it's likely one reason he is still with us
customer_reviews.text: This is way too expensive. I'm a chemist and will try to find out what's actually in here. Our cat doesn't care about the price of course and he loves it. Any food we give him with the addition of this pixie dust he eats up in no time. This is perfect for our Figaro who is already 14 years old and wouldn't eat anything without pixie dust. We'd have to worry and probably spend a lot more money with the vet if it wasn't for this. thank you
customer_reviews.author: DerAusgewanderte

customer_reviews.title: Helped my Senior cats +++++
customer_reviews.text: This probiotic helped with many medical issues my cats had. Vomiting, hairballs, diet, disposition etc. Brought allot of relief for issues we had for years!! I never knew how much a probiotic could change their lives, and mine! It's pricey, but I've tried other cat probiotics, and none worked as well, and really this is the only one my cats would accept. It's a beef flavor and they took to it immediately. I'm so glad I found Purina Pro Plan FortiFlora Cat Probiotic Supplement.
customer_reviews.author: PAPhillips

customer_reviews.title: OVERRATED PRODUCT
customer_reviews.text: Pro: The #1 ingredient is animal digest which most cats LOVE. That is probably the big hype for the product. The only reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because the cats will eat anything that this is sprinkled on. Cons: Only1 type of microorganism and only 100 million CFU per application. Packaging are small packets which are difficult to manage. There is probably more paper in 1 box than the fortiflora itself Way way too expensive for what you get. There are many other more suitable probiotics on the market with better pricing, multiple microorganisms, and 10 times the CFUs. The only thing this product has going is the addictive taste for the cats.
customer_reviews.author: c. i.

customer_reviews.title: Can't be without this
customer_reviews.text: This stuff saves my cat's skin and fur. She is super itchy and we tried everything the vet had, but it's Fortiflora on her dry food every day that's stopped the skin flaking and over grooming. Her fur has grown back (she was over 50% bald) and she's noticeably less agitated. It took into the 2nd month to fully notice the effects but we're 6 months in and it's sustained.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT buy from Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kitten who had soft stool and after 1 packet had explosive diarrhea multiple times. The next day he was fine and I didn’t give him any of the fortiflora. I didn’t put the connection together until I gave the second pack, after which he started vomiting profusely. I am so worried about him now. Do not buy this from Amazon, I am convinced everything they sell is counterfeit or has something wrong with it, as I had a similar experience with both dog and cat food bought from here.
customer_reviews.author: S.D.

customer_reviews.title: Product ingredients have changed WHICH IS A PROBLEM
customer_reviews.text: Just received a new box (expires July 13, 2021) and tried it out even tho I have more envelopes of the older product (expired Jan 30, 2020). Surprised when my cat wouldn't eat his food when the new shipment was sprinkled on. BUT he gobbled it down when I reverted back to the older envelopes. Then I compared the ingredients. The older product's first ingredient is listed as ANIMAL DIGEST, the newer product's first ingredient listed is LIVER FLAVOR. WHY OH WHY PURINA DID YOU DO THIS. YOU MUST KNOW THAT CATS ARE VERY FINICKY EATERS. PLEASE REVERT BACK TO THE ORIGINAL FLAVOR!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: rimtraveler

customer_reviews.title: Cats LOVE it
customer_reviews.text: I have used this before on my cats when they were suffering diarrhea from meds and it helped a lot so I bought more to use on a new kitten I rescued that was having issues from dewormer. It seemed like it took awhile to work this time and I thought maybe it wasn't but I think it helped and she is fine now. One thing about this is you really need to hide it from your cats. They will sniff it out and eat the packets. You even have to hide the used, empty packets because they will EAT THEM, lol. I swear, this stuff is cat crack. They go nuts over it.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Too pricey just because it is for pet
customer_reviews.text: Too expensive for only 30 day supply. I regret that I didn't do any research before purchasing. The taste might be good though, as it has flavor to attract cats. I used this only for a few days and switched to a human grade probiotics supplement. It does the same job, but is more reliable in quality control and cheaper than pet grade products.
customer_reviews.author: Yang

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: Bubba came down with extreme diarrhea. I was going to take him to the vet but i thought it was due to food changes. I took him off friskies. Started giving him tuna salmon and feesh foods slong with this formula. He has become youthful again playful gained the weight back and seems happier overall. This was our miracle fix for our comfort kitten. Who works with dementia and aurism patients
customer_reviews.author: sp

customer_reviews.title: Counterfeit product
customer_reviews.text: Counterfeit. I have a cat with a tendency for soft stools. Fortiflora helps with it. I got this from Amazon and she started having soft stools again. I got Fortiflora from Chewy and two days later, she's back to normal. I wouldn't recommend it since it's fake. Like alot of stuff on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: MD REDBIRD

customer_reviews.title: FortiFlora cat supplement
customer_reviews.text: I have used this supplement before. Actually haven’t tasted it myself. However my cat who is outrageously picky must like the taste and smell. I have to sometimes sprinkle it on his wet food to get him to eat it, and I’m using Weruva and BFF wet cat food that is mostly meat and gravy thickeners no veggies or fruits. He won’t eat the other brands of wet cat food. But like I said my cat is supremely picky and gets bored easily.
customer_reviews.author: Mom Josephine

customer_reviews.title: Works well & cats like the taste
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by my vet for one of my cats who has chronic sneezing / upper respiratory issues. This has REALLY helped her. Just one pack a day mixed into a bit of soft food. I now use on any cats that start to get sniffles & it works better than powdered lysine. Even my most finicky cats will eat it mixed in soft food. I wish it was a bit less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Probiotic for my Cats!
customer_reviews.text: The veterinarian recommended this probiotic when one of my cats had a digestive issue several years ago. I have been buying it ever since, and all my cats really love it. It is excellent for the health of their gut, and it restores the flora the cats lose when having digestive issues. Though it can seem a bit expensive sometimes, it is nonetheless an excellent product, worth buying. I've tried other more affordable probiotics, but my cats refuse to eat them. So... why try to fix something that needs no fixing? :) I highly recommend this probiotic!
customer_reviews.author: Adriana Adarve

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Approved
customer_reviews.text: Kitty started having mushy stools and difficulty defalcating, tiring of squatting and simply laying down while going. I don’t have to describe the mess. Gut antibiotics did nothing. After the antibiotic were finished, the vet gave me samples of this stuff. It was expired, but she seemed to really like the taste. Her stool is back to normal for now, and that is a blessing. To be fair, she also switched from KD to another kidney friendly food, but I’m sure this stuff helped. It’s expensive, but I think we’ll worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Milhouse

customer_reviews.title: Vet approved
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat with digestive issues, and while searching the Internet for ideas on how to ease his IBS, I heard about FortiFlora. So I bought some and started adding it to his food about once a week. He had no problem with the taste, and, although it didn't cure his IBS, when I took him to our vet and told her about giving it to him, she wholeheartedly supported it. She said it was a good probiotic supplement and could only do him good, and I could even give it to our other cat to help maintain her system, too. I will definitely keep giving them FortiFlora a couple times a month.
customer_reviews.author: LeeAnn Renshaw

customer_reviews.title: Best kitty crack around.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is magic. We work with a rescue and foster dozens of kittens a year. They usually come in with parasites and infections. A good probiotic is essential. It has to have an appealing taste, too. Forta flora does the trick. We sprinkle it on all the cats' food. It entices sick or finicky cats to eat. That's why we call it kitty crack.
customer_reviews.author: D. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Meowy Good
customer_reviews.text: My cat, Chase, is such a hit and miss eater - I bought this product because someone told me it tastes so good that it stimulates the appetite. I put it on his kibble and he ate every single bite - something rare. I'm super happy with the results!
customer_reviews.author: Aby

customer_reviews.title: Picky Cats Eat What They Snub
customer_reviews.text: Cats LOVE this. The picky, picky cats one day like something you give them to eat, the next, NO. I use light sprinkle atop wet or dry occassionally to give them a probiotic and encourage them to eat the expensive food they snub once in a while. These are costly, not much in each packet, but so is throwing away the food. It attracts them to the food like catnip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Check the Expiration Date
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my 19 year old cat. It is a thirty day supply. A few days after giving it to him I noticed it was due to expire in about two weeks. It’s pretty bad to spend that much and not even get to use all of it before it expires. Very disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ShoppingIsMyHobby

customer_reviews.title: Magic make cat healthy/make cat eat dust
customer_reviews.text: Cannot say enough good about this product. Was suggested by my vet for my new rescue who has many yet unexplained health issues, despite lots of testing over the years by the rescue. He is finally extracting nutrients from his food and was able to fight off his infections. He was lethargic and unkempt, now he is happy, healthy coated, and energetic. I feel like this saved his life. Wish I had known about this years ago, so many cats could have benefited. Worth the expense. Amazing added bonus, you can get a finicky cat to eat anything with this magic powder. Unreal.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Resolved 15-year old cat’s respiratory issues
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old cat seemed to have a lot of junk in her nose - she was sneezing a lot and making weird respiratory sounds. Took her to the vet. No infection - vet recommended this product, saying older cats often need an immune system boost. Started her on this. 1-2 months later, all symptoms gone, and I’ve heard her running around upstairs like a kitten again. Now I reorder every month. It’s a powder mix-in. I sprinkle it right on her dry food and I think it smells a little odd—kinda like beef boullion but she seems to like it, so bonus.
customer_reviews.author: KAllen

customer_reviews.title: Product expiration on 3 boxes is too close
customer_reviews.text: Have been a loyal customer for years, but this last batch of 3 had an expiration date of less than a month away. I let Amazon know and they sent a second batch of 3 with the same expiration day of less than a month away. Probiotics aren't products that you want to use expired.
customer_reviews.author: nature lover

customer_reviews.title: Encourages eating which keeps weight on and them healthier for longer.
customer_reviews.text: Elderly cats needed probiotic after antibiotics. The scent encougages eating for those kitties with health issues who struggle eat. Our cats go to vet very regular to ease them thru their health issues. Stage 3 renal failure and thyriod issues. So we are walking a delecate balance to keep them living quality life. We know their time is short but they are family so whatever helps them still enjoy life. We are on a budget so wasting cat food is not in our plan. This encourages their eating which keeps weight on and them healthier for longer.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: This Pro Plan is not getting my cat to eat ...
customer_reviews.text: This Pro Plan is not getting my cat to eat much. So she is not getting the probiotic. I have tried it on different wet cat food. She will take a little but still won't eat much. Update - the cat is now eating but with Pro Plan, she is back to vomiting. So I stopped the ProPlan and she is doing much better. I am sure other cats do fine on ProPlan. My cat is also on a sensitive stomach diet and has been for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria Williams

customer_reviews.title: My senior cats LOVE this stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My biggest issue was my cats not wanting to eat -- no matter what food I'd offer, they'd like it and walk away. They were losing weight, and this was especially concerning because of their age (15 yrs / 18 yrs). When I added this to their food, they both went nuts!!!! Seriously, I'd buy this just for the flavoring even if it didn't have the probiotic!!! They now are eager to eat each meal and they're putting back on some weight (getting back towards normal, not overweight). This product is fantastic for them!
customer_reviews.author: Cygnus

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has had diarrhea since he was a kitten. We tested him for worms and had negative results. We switched to gluten free foods and it didn’t help. We decided to try this and started to see results after two weeks! We will continue to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Halebopps

customer_reviews.title: Received old stock.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a regular buyer if this prudent and been happy up till today. Received old stock. Arrived today 10/3. Best by is 10/27. Can’t use all 30 before the best by date. Unacceptable and disappointed that Amazon would pass in old stock like this at full price.
customer_reviews.author: L. Hop

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea if this tastes good, but my cats seem to like it and the vet says it's good for them. Compared to one they gave me, they love it. The one from the vet made them literally walk away from their food without touching it. This one they even eat on dry food--one of my cats will eat all of his food and try to eat the other cat's food too.
customer_reviews.author: kayo

customer_reviews.title: Best to administer just before feeding time
customer_reviews.text: Helps my kidney cat, was told he would die 2 years ago but he's still going strong. I use this along with kidney support gold. He gets fortiflora and kidney support gold every 12 hours via oral syringe. Using a clean plate, 5 drops of kidney support gold, 10 drops of water and a measured smidgen of fortiflora, draw it into a 1ml syringe, puts the syringe to .6ml. Best to administer just before feeding time. It don't seem like a lot of work to me because my best buddy in the whole world gets to live longer.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it and seems to be helping GI system
customer_reviews.text: I sprinkle it on my cat's wet food and mix it in. It has a beef bouillon smell to me (can't comment on the taste lol) and it seems to dissolve or blend well into her wet food so I think its pretty water soluble. She is a picky cat with texture and taste so she is happy with it! I use one packet over the course of the day, instead of per meal. Seems to work just as well. her puking and potty issues are much better.
customer_reviews.author: Becs234

customer_reviews.title: It Worked!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cat that had stinky diarrhea and vomiting for over a year. I gave it to her after nothing the vet tried helped. It cured her after about three weeks. I continue to mix half of a packet a day into her can food. And she clearly likes the taste since I have no problem getting her to eat the food with it mixed in. It's definitely worth a try if your cat has stomach issues.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget_Inspector

customer_reviews.title: Beyond impressed.
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea this was even a thing until our vet recommended it for our very sick foster kittens. I have been very impressed with the product. Our kitties don't even notice it's there because I mix it in their wet food. Even our little runt of the litter who has had lots of food issues willingly eats his food with this in it. I hate the smell, but I'm not the one eating it. All of our kittens tummy troubles calmed down shortly after starting this product, and it is now a staple at our house.
customer_reviews.author: jjcrazycat

customer_reviews.title: Saved My Cat's Life
customer_reviews.text: Kyle has always had a sensitive stomach and wound up in vet emergency one night because he wasn't digesting his food properly. Bad constipation, dehydrated, vomiting, howling, farting, panting.... Half a dozen tests and $700 later the emergency vet suggested this particular probiotic, FortiFlora as a supplement to his grain free salmon fancy feast. Kyle is very healthy and happy now.
customer_reviews.author: Shreddr

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I work with animals and have worked both rescue and clinical so I'm familiar with how great this product is from many uses. I bought a box for my foster kittens because they had some loose stool due to stress. After adding this to their food their stools got better. Of course speak to your veterinarian before purchasing for any aliments your kitty may be experiencing but I have had great experience with this product.
customer_reviews.author: NMG

customer_reviews.title: Necessary option
customer_reviews.text: To get cats to eat something new, sprinkling a light dusting amount on top of the food causes better acceptance of the food. I also sprinkle a light amount of nutritional yeast- it will helps if I can now coax the cats to accept just the yeast. Then I can save some money. This product is too expensive but it works. This is the type product Purina and others spray on the outside of dry food to make it irresistible. If I grind up the dry food our cats won't eat the food- they need the taste of this product which is animal digest- sad about the actual taste of the food.
customer_reviews.author: Gary B.

customer_reviews.title: Check Expiration Dates!!
customer_reviews.text: When I received my order in August, the expiration on all 3 boxes was October 29th. Less than 3 months til expiration. Which was the same expiration as the previous order I had bought several months before. I have 3 cats, but unless you own a cat shelter you’ll never use that much product prior to expiration. I would’ve returned it if my cats weren’t already out and a couple of them need it to keep from throwing up all over my house. So I’ll be eating about half the cost of this order.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Really helps my cat.
customer_reviews.text: My cat goes through periods of stomach upset where he often vomits after eating (not hairballs). Through experimentation, we've found that it takes only a tiny bit per day to keep his stomach happy, so you don't need to use a whole packet per day, which would be very costly. He loves the flavor, as evidenced by him chewing up a packet we had carelessly left on the counter top.
customer_reviews.author: Heather G

customer_reviews.title: If you are using this as a probiotic, I ...
customer_reviews.text: If you are using this as a probiotic, I would suggest looking up digestive enzymes and probiotics by Naturvet. It's much cheaper and works wonders. I keep this on hand because of the added flavoring in it to use with medicine. Even with pill pockets, my cat won't take her pill, but If I wrap it in a pill pocket then put a little water on it and sprinkle FortiFlora on it she gobbles it up. Definitely a life saver.
customer_reviews.author: P. Bova

customer_reviews.title: Cats do like this; but pricey.
customer_reviews.text: Why ask people about scent or flavor? Ehh? We have elderly cats, who need to be encouraged to eat. This is not only good biologically (so our vet explains) but there's something about it which does lure our cats to eat. I've read reviews, asked other cat owners, and this really does seem to be the most effective. However, the price differential is probably difficult for a lot of cat owners.
customer_reviews.author: CatBookMom

customer_reviews.title: The probiotic seemed to help my cat
customer_reviews.text: My 17 year old Himalayan was looking ill. He was not eating hardly at all and was lethargic. Not knowing what to do I took a chance with the probiotic powder. He seemed to like the taste and began eating more vigorously. His energy level has picked up and he seems to be back to his normal self. I am SO happy. I just put a little in his food. A packet lasts for about 4 meals. I gave it 2 stars for value though because it is expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for my cats
customer_reviews.text: I have two ragdoll cats that are known for their sensitive stomach. And these probiotics work like a charm to solve their soft stool issue. As my cats grow older, they get finicky and picky about their food. Then I will sprinkle some of these probiotics on the top of the food and they will immediately finish their plate. This is a must-have for my cat's diet and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Spartan Girl

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after reading that it may get my cat to eat its food. It worked! I transitioned my cat to having more wet food (removed all dry) and adding this to the food made a world of difference. Before, they refused to eat. Mix in the FortiFlora packet and leave a little left over to sprinkle on the top. My cats actually now eat their food!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing for my cat
customer_reviews.text: Shortly after I adopted my cat, I realized she had a terrible diarrhea problem. Took her to the vet...nothing worked. I tried this and it was immediately resolved. Bottom line: with this, clean butt. Without, poop EVERYWHERE. That's a good enough endorsement for me. Also, it is a bit pricey, but I can now give her 1/2 a pouch per day, and she's still doing fine.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Cat Smack (addictive?)
customer_reviews.text: I cannot speak to any possible health benefits, but if I buy a food that my persnickety cats ignore, a light sprinkle of this supplement will assure that they clean their plates. I assume they are not eating it because it is healthy; they are eating it because it is mainly powdered liver. It works even better than sprinkling on dried minnows (although those work well too.)
customer_reviews.author: O'K

customer_reviews.title: An essential tool in the cat health tool kit
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this for several years for diarrhea and for general good gastrointestinal health. I recently read something that made me think it might also be a flavor enhancer to entice reluctant eaters to eat... I have started using it in that way and I definitely see results. I have tried other probiotics and the cats have not eaten them. There’s no problem with this one.
customer_reviews.author: raggmopp

customer_reviews.title: My kitty loves this stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I don't really like Purina as a brand, but I do use this stuff. I sprinkle it on her food when she won't eat and she loves it. Also, I think it is a good supplement for her digestion, though I wouldn't give it to her all the time. The flavoring may not be so great for a cat, I don't know.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly

customer_reviews.title: I think this supplement is adding years to my cats life!
customer_reviews.text: I have an older female cat with kidney failure. Once diagnosed we changed her diet to wet food, no grains and she almost stopped eating altogether. After searching for something to make her like food enough to eat it, I tried this. It is now a standard add in to her evening meal. She just loves this flavor. I hope it is also helping her guy flora, but we got it to make her new food more appealing, it worked! If you have a cat who is not interested in food, this might be the ticket to get them eating!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ann M.

customer_reviews.title: Healthy ramen packet!
customer_reviews.text: My cat suffers from constant upper respiratory issues (sneezing, hacking, nasal discharge and buildup) and the vet recommended this for him. In addition I give him some other immune support but this is a good addition to help his body keep up. This is easy to mix into cat food with water and it makes a broth almost like a ramen packet 😆. He likes is and it helps him greatly! Worth the $$
customer_reviews.author: natalie

customer_reviews.title: MUST USE FOR ALL CAT/KITTEN OWNERS
customer_reviews.text: Highly reccommend for anyone that has a cat/kitten needing some extra probiotic support! My foster kittens took to it asap and it actually helped me wean them onto canned wet food. I also referred it to several family friends of mine that have older cats that aren't eating as much. I wish i knew about this product back when my 19year old Cat Ozzie was still around! This would've been amazing for him.
customer_reviews.author: Savannah Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Individual packets helpful
customer_reviews.text: I had foster kittens with chronic diarrhea who didn’t respond to 3 other medications that the vet had put them on so I bought this product out of desperation. It took about 2 weeks for the kittens to be cured.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cats absolutely love it!
customer_reviews.text: I was actually prescribed this at the vet and for seven packets it wasn’t cheap! I decided to look and see if I could buy it on my own and to my pleasant surprise I could! I have the pickiest cats in the world and when I sprinkle this on their food they love it and actually eat with enjoyment compared to How they normally eat. I am so glad they like it because I feel sad about their boring diet LOL! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Debra Fredrickson

customer_reviews.title: Feline appetite - digestion.
customer_reviews.text: I own several small dogs and whenever they had trouble eating or had stool problems, the vet prescribed canine FortiFlora. When one of my Ragdolls started to get fussy and had runny stools, I saved money by using the experience I had learned from my vet for my dogs and saw this product on line and was thrilled. I open a pack when my cats act picky or when I see a change in their stools and I am glad I saved a trip to the vet. The product will not harm your pet.
customer_reviews.author: 98northwood

customer_reviews.title: Fix ill kitty, this works for diarrhea or after/during antibiotics
customer_reviews.text: My cat had just gotten off antibiotics and had diarrhea, and generally just not feeling that well. I purchased these probiotics and had him take them for 30 days, about a week in his stool was of solid state and he returned to happy kitty. 30 pouches of probiotic powder, just mix one pouch in with wet food once a day. Super easy, cat loved the flavor and ate with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Amazondragonfly

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: I feed my cat homemade food and I use this mainly to encourage her to finish her food when it’s served and to eat the kinds of meat that she doesn’t like so much for the sake of a balanced diet. I sprinkle a tiny bit of this on top of the food and my cat eats it right up. Pretty cost-effective for the purrpose since a packet lasts many meals.
customer_reviews.author: Bowie

customer_reviews.title: Helps with gut health and cats love the taste
customer_reviews.text: Helps with loose stools. Unlike other probiotics, my cats LOVE the taste. I divide the packet between my cats and give it to them every other day. Expensive but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Sue

customer_reviews.title: Cats love the taste
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended by a vet for rescue cats that had intestinal problems from their previous living conditions. NOTE: do not use this product instead of seeing a vet or instead of doctor recommended antibiotics. This is a supplement to help restore a healthy intestinal balance after tests confirm that the parasites/ viruses are gone.
customer_reviews.author: Mr&Mrs

customer_reviews.title: A life saver
customer_reviews.text: These probiotics have helped my cat who has IBD improve greatly. Many mornings he has a bad taste in his mouth and refuses breakfast, but the probiotics smell and taste great to him, so with that added he wolfs down his breakfast and is again gaining weight and health. All three cats love the smell and taste of these. They are easy to use. A truly helpful and wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Dr FAZ

customer_reviews.title: Great product, super price
customer_reviews.text: My vet originally got me interested in this product for my 19 year old cat. About a month after I started giving her the probiotics I realized that her eyes didn't have the constant goopy tears running down by her nose. Her appetite improved and she started putting a little weight back on. I wanted to do what was best for her in her very senior years. So I decided to continue with the FortiFlora, but looked to Amazon for a cheaper price. Of course I found what I was looking for immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Trician

customer_reviews.title: It's like kitty crack
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this. It's like kitty crack. I use it when she's being stubborn about eating her dinner, and it also firmed things up when she got the runs after surgery. She was losing a fair amount of weight for a while! I'm glad I got things under control. It comes in little packets that you can sprinkle on wet or dry food. It sticks to the dry food a lot better than you would expect, and of course it sticks to the wet food just fine. I only give half a packet per meal, so it is a little bit annoying to have to save the opened packets until the next meal, but overall it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy

customer_reviews.title: Thank goodness for Fortiflora
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 cats. They love Fortiflora. I mix in a packet with a little water to every can of food. They would eat this plain if I let them. Best of all, they have perfect poops! I recently got a new kitten. I had to ween him off the kitten food to the same canned food the other 4 eat. Using this product helped his digestive system so he wouldn't have loose poops during the transition. It's worth every penny, and it really works.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Purple

customer_reviews.title: One of our cats has had digestive issues for some ...
customer_reviews.text: One of our cats has had digestive issues for some time, his weight has fluctuated as much as eight pounds, a big loss for a cat, I have tried other supplements but none have been effective and most don't appeal to him beyond the first day when he is initially curious. He went right for this sprinkled over a food that he typically rejects, he ate the entire bowl of the food. I am hopeful that this will help his diarrhea as well.
customer_reviews.author: carol parker

customer_reviews.title: Essentiale for enteric care
customer_reviews.text: Great item to keep on hand if you have cats. Palatability is excellent. Makes food attractive to those with poor appetite.This can be a literal lifesaver for young ones. Use under the supervision of a Veterinarian. A little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: keep it simple

customer_reviews.title: HIV and Felv Cats' Daily Supplement!
customer_reviews.text: Several years ago my vet recommended Fortiflora Feline Nutritional Supplement for my senior cats with feline aids and leukemia. It has made a huge difference in keeping my cats regular and their stool firm. I definitely recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: K.M. Brunner

customer_reviews.title: Helps the unliked healthy food to go down!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the first package after my cat had to take antibiotics du to a urinary tract blockage. His stool returned to normal pretty soon, and he's doing well. Why I ordered more of the product, however, is because mixing this powder into the not-so-loved CD urinary tract canned food helps tremendously in getting the cat to eat it! At $1 per package (30 in a box), that's not a cheap operation, so I only use 1/3 to 1/2 a package per meal, and not every day. But what to do with a male cat in the risk group of crystal builup in the bladder? (Hint: Don't give them cheap/dry food to begin with!)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for appetite!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to encourage my older cat to eat as others stated in their reviews. Not fond of the animal digest as ingredients but my cat couldn't afford to lose more weight. He wouldn't eat his food without this for three weeks but now doesn't seem to want it on there. I think animals know when something will help and when they don't need it anymore. Well worth the cost and I only sprinkled a bit on the food, not the whole pouch. Probably got four meals out of one pouch doing it that way. He absolutely would not eat, not even tuna fish.
customer_reviews.author: pattysue

customer_reviews.title: My Cat LOVES this Stuff
customer_reviews.text: We noticed a severe decrease in my cats appetite and decided to give this a try. After less than a week his appetite is back and just as hardy as when he was a kitten. His energy is back up and he’s much more vocal for his breakfast too.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Joyce

customer_reviews.title: My cat is addicted!
customer_reviews.text: My senior cat with chronic diarrhea has been using this product for 1 week so far. We haven’t noticed a difference yet, but we are giving it a few weeks. I can say I was worried about the taste and if he would eat it. As you can see, he loves the taste so much, he tries to lick it from the packet. He thinks of it as a treat. Fingers crossed it works. Will update my review in a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat with some IBD issues and this helps her colon health. I can't vouch for the flavor (LOL) but she likes it and my other cat as well. It smells pleasant to me, something like boullion cubes. She appears to like the taste and helps cut down on vomiting as well.
customer_reviews.author: Foxcat

customer_reviews.title: Product about to expire
customer_reviews.text: This product has an 18 month shelf life, yet the package I received will expire it 2 months. II won’t end up using it all that soon, so feel like I’ve wasted money buying something that will go bad before I can use it. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Laura, Portland, OR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product!  Cats love the taste as well.
customer_reviews.text: Anytime my older cat is on antibiotics I give this to him sprinkled on his food. He loves it and it keeps him from getting diarrhea from the medicine. It has a terrific taste-attractant, so if a cat is not wanting to eat for any reason, this really helps. I've used it on foster kittens who had upper respiratory infections and were not wanting to touch food.
customer_reviews.author: Joan P

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My 10-year-old, perfectly healthy cat suddenly had IBS with diarrhea. I couldn't get her to ingest any other probiotic. I tried this because a previous reviewer said her cat licked it up without even putting it into food. I poured a packet into a bowl, mixed it with a tiny bit of water (sort of a gravy consistency), and my cat lapped it up like it was a treat! I do that every day now. Her loose bowel situation has improved. It's not 100% better, but it's better and much less smelly.
customer_reviews.author: ranchomaia

customer_reviews.title: their poo smelled like dead animals
customer_reviews.text: I adopted two shelter kittens who were very sick with upper respiratory infections. After a month of antibiotics, their poo smelled like dead animals. I assumed that their gut flora was wiped out by the drugs and ordered some of this. Within two days, their poo stopped smelling so horribly, even though they continued on the antibiotics. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: awgoodkitty

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product, sent in pristine condition, expiration date was well off. Favorable pricing. Cat was prescribed this after he had been administered a fair bit of antibiotics and wound up with the feline equivalent of C Dif (it's not called that). It cleared up his digestive woes. Didn't use the entire box. Had hoped to use this off-label as an appetite enhancer, as some of the websites I visited recommended it for that use. It did not work for that purpose with my elderly cat, however.
customer_reviews.author: Oh why not?

customer_reviews.title: FORTIFLORA SAVED MY CATS LIFE.
customer_reviews.text: THIS STUFF SAVED MY CATS LIFE! My cat has a tumor and it was making her puke so she was emaciated. She had no muscle left. After a couple weeks of using Fortiflora, my cat began to drink, eat, and even play like the 2 year old she is! Truly magical stuff, THANK YOU from the bottom of my heart! I truly believe she would have died without this amazing medicine!
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

product_meta.title: Purina Pro Plan Veterinary Diets Probiotics Cat Supplement
product_meta.description: Size:1 PackFortiFlora for Cats FortiFlora Feline is a specially formulated probiotic solution developed by Purina to help cats suffering from digestive trouble. Just like people, cats can have digestion trouble that leads to upset stomachs, diarrhea, and abnormal stools. By taking FortiFlora regularly, this digestive supplement can restore your cat's intestinal health and balance and improve the functioning of their digestive system. The great thing about ForiFlora for cats is that it's easy to administer: all you have to do is mix it into your kitty's food for it to take effect. The main ingredient of ForiFlora Feline is a probiotic compound called Enterococcus. This special probiotic serves the function of restoring the microflora balance in your cat's intestines, leading to better functioning of the bowels. The probiotic is also supplemented by nutritional additives such as protein, vitamins, and minerals to improve your pet's overall health. Besides helping with digestive issues, Fotiflora can also help relieve stress, improve digestition after acute enteritis, restore apetite, and serve as an antibiotic therapy, strengthening the immune system. Each box of FortiFlora Feline contains 30 packets, which is enough for 30 servings.
feature_bullets: One (1) 30-Count Box - Purina Pro Plan Veterinary Diets Probiotics Cat Supplement, Fortiflora Feline Nutritional Supplement
FortiFlora is the #1 probiotic recommended by veterinarians (Kynetec, Probiotic Recommendation Study, March 2019)
Probiotic supplement for the dietary management of kittens and adult cats with diarrhea
Contains a probiotic to promote normal intestinal microflora
Proprietary microencapsulation process for enhanced stability
